name: Make-Ahead Chicken Divan Casserole
author: Mod Mom
summary: My entire family loves this dish. The word “casserole” is in the name since traditional chicken divan is made separate from the rice and served alongside it. This can be prepared a day or two in advance and baked before serving. Simplify the process by using leftover cooked rice and a store-bought cooked chicken.
ingredients: ½ cup shredded Parmesan cheese, or more to taste
1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup
salt and ground black pepper to taste
2 cups cooked rice, or more to taste
5 cups shredded cooked chicken, or more to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Combine Cheddar cheese and 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese in a bowl and set aside
Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steamer
Add broccoli, cover, and steam until tender, 2 to 6 minutes
Meanwhile, melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat
Add mushrooms, onion, and garlic; saute until soft, 5 to 7 minutes
Whisk condensed soup, sour cream, milk, and mayonnaise together in a large bowl
Add 1/2 cup of the reserved Cheddar-Parmesan mixture and season with salt and pepper
Add the sauteed vegetables and stir to combine the sauce
Spread 1/2 cup of the sauce onto the bottom of a 9x13-inch casserole dish
Add cooked rice as the bottom layer
Add cooked broccoli as the next layer, and then layer on the cooked chicken
Pat down evenly and smooth with a spatula
Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes
Sprinkle with remaining Cheddar-Parmesan mixture, plus extra Parmesan if desired, and continue to bake until browned, about 15 minutes more
